sen.j: 峰山海軍航空隊（みねやまかいぐんこうくうたい）は、大日本帝国海軍の部隊の一つ。
sen.e: Mineyama Naval Air Squadron was one of the squadrons of the Imperial Japanese Navy.
The Mineyama Naval Air Squadron was one of the squadrons of the Imperial Japanese Navy.
The Mineyama Naval Air Squadron was one of the squadrons of the Imperial Japanese Navy.

sen.j: 中練教程の搭乗員の教育を推進するため、予科練卒業生への実機練習を推進した。
sen.e: It promoted on-the-ground training of preparatory school graduates in order to educate mid-level airmen.
It promoted on-the-ground training of preparatory school graduates in order to educate mid-level airmen.
It promoted on-the-ground training of preparatory school graduates in order to educate mid-level airmen.

sen.j: 部隊が駐留した旧河辺村（大宮町を経て現・京丹後市）に隣接する峰山町（現・京丹後市）の表記に合わせて「峰山」と表記する例が多いが、当時の隊員らは「峯山」と表記することが多い。
sen.e: Mineyama is most often written with the Chinese characters 峰山, the same characters as used for the Mineyama town (currently Kyotango City) adjacent to the Kawabe Village (which became Oomiya Town, and now Kyotango City) where the squadron was stationed, but the members of the squadron more often used the characters 峯山.

Mineyama is most often written with the Chinese characters 峰山, the same characters as used for Mineyama town (currently Kyotango City) adjacent to Kawabe Village (which became Oomiya Town, and now Kyotango City) where the squadron was stationed, but the members of the squadron more often used the characters 峯山.

Mineyama is most often written with the Chinese characters 峰山, the same characters as used for Mineyama Town (currently Kyotango City) adjacent to Kawabe Village (which became Omiya Town, and now Kyotango City) where the squadron was stationed, but the members of the squadron more often used the characters 峯山.

sen.j: 沿革
sen.e: Outline
Outline
Outline

sen.j: 日華事変の泥沼化に加え、張鼓峰事件とノモンハン事件が相次いで勃発したことから、海軍はソビエト連邦に対する迎撃策を講じることになった。
sen.e: The Imperial Navy began to plan for the offensive against the Soviet Union when the Second Sino-Japanese War was drawn into a quagmire and Changkufeng Incident and Nomonhan Incident occurred one after the other.

The Imperial Navy began to plan for the offensive against the Soviet Union when the Second Sino-Japanese War was drawn into a quagmire and Changkufeng Incident and Nomonhan Incident occurred one after the other.

The Imperial Navy began to plan for the offensive against the Soviet Union when the Second Sino-Japanese War was drawn into a quagmire and Changkufeng Incident and Nomonhan Incident occurred one after the other.

sen.j: 舞鶴鎮守府隷下の舞鶴海軍航空隊は偵察部隊であるため、舞鶴軍港の防空に必要な陸上機が駐留できる基地として、中郡 (京都府)京丹後市に河辺飛行場を造成した。
sen.e: The Maizuru Naval Air Squadron which belonged to the Maizuru Naval Rear Unit Headquarters was a patrol unit, so the Kawabe Air Base was constructed in Kyotango City, Chugun (Kyoto Prefecture) in order that the army planes necessary to defend the air space above Maizuru military port could be stationed.
sen.cmt: 舞鶴鎮守府の正式英訳不明。
sen.e: The Maizuru Naval Air Squadron which belonged to the Maizuru Naval Rear Unit Headquarters was a patrol unit, so the Kawabe Air Base was constructed in Kyotango City, Chugun (Kyoto Prefecture) so that the army planes necessary to defend the air space above Maizuru military port could be stationed.

The Maizuru Naval Air Squadron which belonged to the Maizuru Naval Rear Unit Headquarters was a patrol unit, so the Kawabe Air Base was constructed in Kyotango City, Chugun (Kyoto Prefecture) so that the army planes necessary to defend the air space above Maizuru military port could be stationed.

sen.j: 太平洋戦争中期に、逼迫する航空要員の大量育成を図るため、全国各地に訓練部隊が増設された。
sen.e: Training units were established throughout Japan half way through the war in the Pacific in order to meet the high demand for airmen.
Training units were established throughout Japan half way through the war in the Pacific in order to meet the high demand for airmen.
Training units were established throughout Japan half way through the war in the Pacific in order to meet the high demand for airmen.

sen.j: 後方基地として遊休化していた河辺飛行場に目をつけた海軍は、ここに中練教程練習航空隊を設置することにした。
sen.e: The Imperial Navy had its eye on the Kawabe Airport which had been designated as a rear base and had not been used, decided to station a mid-level training air unit there.
The Imperial Navy had its eye on the Kawabe Airport which had been designated as a rear base and had not been used, decided to station a mid-level training air unit there.
The Imperial Navy had its eye on the Kawabe Airport which had been designated as a rear base and had not been used, decided to station a mid-level training air unit there.

sen.j: 3月15日 美保海軍航空隊第二美保海軍航空隊峰山分遣隊開隊。
sen.e: March 15 Mineyama Detachment Unit of the Second Miho Naval Air Squadron of the Miho Naval Air Squadron was established.
March 15 Mineyama Detachment Unit of the Second Miho Naval Air Squadron of the Miho Naval Air Squadron was established.
March 15 Mineyama Detachment Unit of the Second Miho Naval Air Squadron of the Miho Naval Air Squadron was established.

sen.j: 三重海軍航空隊より予科練特乙3期卒業生入隊。
sen.e: Graduates from the third special class of the preparatory school of Mie Naval Air Squadron joined the unit.
sen.cmt: どこに入隊かはっきりしませんが、上記の分遣隊に入隊と解釈
sen.e: Graduates from the third special class of the preparatory school of Mie Naval Air Squadron joined the unit.
Graduates from the third special class of the preparatory school of Mie Naval Air Squadron joined the unit.

sen.j: 同年8月卒業。
sen.e: They graduated in August.
They graduated in August.
They graduated in August.

sen.j: 7月25日 美保海軍航空隊第一美保海軍航空隊より予科練甲13期前期卒業生入隊。
sen.e: July 25 Graduates from the 13th Ko class of the preparatory school in the First Miho Naval Air Squadron of the Miho Naval Air Squadron joined the unit.
July 25 Graduates from the 13th Ko class of the preparatory school in the First Miho Naval Air Squadron of the Miho Naval Air Squadron joined the unit.
July 25: Graduates from the 13th Ko class of the preparatory school in the First Miho Naval Air Squadron of the Miho Naval Air Squadron joined the unit.

sen.j: 9月20日 奈良海軍航空隊より予科練甲13期前期卒業生入隊。
sen.e: September 20 Graduates from the 13th Ko class of the preparatory school in the Nara Naval Air Squadron joined the unit.
September 20 Graduates from the 13th Ko class of the preparatory school in the Nara Naval Air Squadron joined the unit.
September 20: Graduates from the 13th Ko class of the preparatory school in the Nara Naval Air Squadron joined the unit.

sen.j: 1月頃 豪雪のため飛行訓練不能、福岡海軍航空隊に疎開し訓練続行。
sen.e: Around January, extraordinarily heavy snow made the flight training impossible, so the men were moved to the Fukuoka Naval Air Base for training.
sen.cmt: 福岡海軍航空[隊]に疎開はおかしいので、基地に疎開としました。
sen.e: Around January, extraordinarily heavy snow made the flight training impossible, so the men were moved to the Fukuoka Naval Air Base for training.
Around January, extraordinarily heavy snow made the flight training impossible, so the men were moved to the Fukuoka Naval Air Base for training.

sen.j: 2月1日 第二美保空の解隊にともない姫路海軍航空隊峰山分遣隊に変更。
sen.e: February 1 The Second Miho Naval Air Squadron was disbanded and became the Mineyama Detachment of the Himeji Naval Air Squadron.
February 1 The Second Miho Naval Air Squadron was disbanded and became the Mineyama Detachment of the Himeji Naval Air Squadron.
February 1: The Second Miho Naval Air Squadron was disbanded and became the Mineyama Detachment of the Himeji Naval Air Squadron.

sen.j: 2月5日 奈良空より予科練甲13期後期卒業生入隊。
sen.e: February 5 The graduates of the second half of the 13th Ko Ｃlass of the preparatory school in the Nara Air Squadron joined the unit.
February 5 The graduates of the second half of the 13th Ko class of the preparatory school in the Nara Air Squadron joined the unit.
February 5: The graduates of the second half of the 13th Ko class of the preparatory school in the Nara Air Squadron joined the unit.

sen.j: 2月20日 飛行訓練凍結・特攻編成開始、「飛神隊」と命名。
sen.e: February 20 Flight training was put on shelf and the forming of a suicide attack squadron began, which was named "Hishin-tai Squadron".
February 20 Flight training was put on the shelf and the forming of a suicide attack squadron began, which was named "Hishin-tai Squadron."
February 20: Flight training was put on the shelf and the forming of a suicide attack squadron began, which was named 'Hishin-tai Squadron.'

sen.j: 選外の隊員は峰山へ帰還。
sen.e: Those members who were not chosen returned to Mineyama.
Those members who were not chosen returned to Mineyama.
Those members who were not chosen returned to Mineyama.

sen.j: 3月1日 独立し「峰山海軍航空隊」開隊。
sen.e: March 1 The squadron became independent and formed the Mineyama Naval Air Squadron.
March 1 The squadron became independent and formed the Mineyama Naval Air Squadron.
March 1: The squadron became independent and formed the Mineyama Naval Air Squadron.

sen.j: 第二十連合航空隊に編入。
sen.e: The squadron was incorporated into the 20th Combined Air Group.
The squadron was incorporated into the 20th Combined Air Group.
The squadron was incorporated into the 20th Combined Air Group.

sen.j: 5月5日 福岡の特攻要員と本隊要員の一部、霞ヶ浦海軍航空隊に転出、特攻訓練・戦備作業に従事。
sen.e: May 5 Those chosen for tokko (suicide) mission and some member from the main unit were incorporated into the Kasumigaura Naval Air Squadron and began training for tokko suicide missions.
May 5 Those chosen for tokko (suicide) missions and some members from the main unit were incorporated into the Kasumigaura Naval Air Squadron and began training for tokko suicide missions.

May 5: Those chosen for tokko (suicide) missions from Fukuoka and some members from the main unit were incorporated into the Kasumigaura Naval Air Squadron and began training for tokko suicide missions.

sen.j: 5月中3回の墜落事故。
sen.e: There were three plane crashes during May.
There were three plane crashes during May.
There were three plane crashes during May.

sen.j: 6月5日 宮津湾で駆逐艦「初霜 (初春型駆逐艦)」を標的とした夜間爆撃訓練中、1機墜落。
sen.e: June 5 One plane crashed during a night training using the destroyer Hatsushimo (Hatsuharu type destroyer) as the target in the Miyazu Bay.
June 5 One plane crashed during night training using the destroyer Hatsushimo (Hatsuharu type destroyer) as the target in the Miyazu Bay.
June 5: One plane crashed during night training using the destroyer Hatsushimo (Hatsuharu type destroyer) as the target in the Miyazu Bay.

sen.j: 6月6日 海軍陸戦隊編成開始。
sen.e: June 6 The Naval Landing Forces began to be formed.
June 6 The Naval Landing Forces began to be formed.
June 6: The Naval Landing Forces began to be formed.

sen.j: 6月30日 舞鶴軍港・宮津湾・河辺飛行場に敵機動部隊艦載機襲来、銃爆撃で機体・施設に被害。
sen.e: June 30 An enemy task force of carrier-based planes attacked Maizuru Military Port, Miyazu Port and Kawabe Air Base, and planes and facilities suffered damages from the combat.
June 30 An enemy task force of carrier-based planes attacked Maizuru Military Port, Miyazu Port and Kawabe Air Base, and planes and facilities suffered damages from the combat.
June 30: An enemy task force of carrier-based planes attacked Maizuru Military Port, Miyazu Port and Kawabe Air Base, and planes and facilities suffered damages from the combat.

sen.j: 7月14日 飛神隊「忠」部隊、鹿屋航空基地に進出。
sen.e: July 14 The "Chu" unit of the Hishin Squadron advanced to the Kanoya Air Base.
July 14 The "Chu" unit of the Hishin Squadron advanced to the Kanoya Air Base.
July 14: The 'Chu' unit of the Hishin Squadron advanced to the Kanoya Air Base.

sen.j: 7月19日 飛神隊「礼」部隊・「武」部隊、岩国飛行場に進出。
sen.e: July 19 The "Rei" unit and the "Bu" unit of the Hishin Squadron advanced to the Iwakuni Air Base.
July 19 The "Rei" unit and the "Bu" unit of the Hishin Squadron advanced to the Iwakuni Air Base.
July 19: The 'Rei' unit and the 'Bu' unit of the Hishin Squadron advanced to the Iwakuni Air Base.

sen.j: 7月27日 飛神隊「義」部隊、岩国に進出。
sen.e: July 27 The "Gi" unit of the Hishin Squadron advanced to Iwakuni.
July 27 The "Gi" unit of the Hishin Squadron advanced to Iwakuni.
July 27: The 'Gi' unit of the Hishin Squadron advanced to Iwakuni.

sen.j: 終戦後、武装解除・解隊。
sen.e: With the end of the war, the squadron was disarmed and disbanded.
With the end of the war, the squadron was disarmed and disbanded.
With the end of the war, the squadron was disarmed and disbanded.

sen.j: 峰山から前進した飛神隊は出撃する機会がないまま終戦を迎えたが、卒業生の一部は実際に出撃している。
sen.e: The Hishin Squadron which advanced from Mineyama never had the opportunity to sally before the war ended but some of the graduates did take part in battles.
The Hishin Squadron which advanced from Mineyama never had the opportunity to rally before the war ended but some of the graduates did take part in battles.
The Hishin Squadron which advanced from Mineyama never had the opportunity to rally before the war ended but some of the graduates did take part in battles.

sen.j: 飛神隊を送り出したあとの飛行場は、本土決戦時の特攻作戦に従事する予定で編成された各地の特攻隊が駐留し、最終的には峰山空要員とほぼ同じ人数に膨れ上がった。
sen.e: After the Hishin Squadron left the air base, soldiers who were organized to take part in the tokko (suicide) mission as part of the battle on the homeland moved in to be stationed at the base, and in the end their numbers expanded to be about the same as that of the members of the Mineyama Air Squadron.

After the Hishin Squadron left the air base, soldiers who were organized to take part in the tokko (suicide) missions as part of the battle on the homeland moved in to be stationed at the base, and in the end their numbers expanded to be about the same as that of the members of the Mineyama Air Squadron.

After the Hishin Squadron left the air base, soldiers who were organized to take part in the tokko (suicide) missions as part of the battle on the homeland moved in to be stationed at the base, and in the end their numbers expanded to be about the same as that of the members of the Mineyama Air Squadron.

sen.j: 終戦後の残務処理は整然と進み、田結穣舞鶴鎮守府司令長官もその手際を絶賛したという。
sen.e: After-war administration was conducted smoothly and the chief of the Maizuru Rear Unit Headquarters, Minoru TAYUI, extended the highest praises.
After-war administration was conducted smoothly and the chief of the Maizuru Rear Unit Headquarters, Minoru TAYUI, extended the highest praises.
After-war administration was conducted smoothly and the chief of the Maizuru Rear Unit Headquarters, Minoru TAYUI, extended the highest praises.

sen.j: 戦後は民間に払い下げられ、滑走路は農地・宅地となった。
sen.e: The base was handed down to the private sector after the war, and the runways became farmland and residential land.
The base was handed down to the private sector after the war, and the runways became farmland and residential land.
The base was handed down to the private sector after the war, and the runways became farmland and residential land.

sen.j: 弾薬庫が放置されているほか、格納庫が繊維工場の倉庫として現存している。
sen.e: There are still magazines as well as hangars, which are used as a storage of a textile factory.
sen.cmt: 弾薬庫や格納庫の数が単数か複数か不明なので複数で処理。
sen.e: There are still magazines as well as hangars, which are used as storage for a textile factory.
There are still magazines as well as hangars, which are used as storage for a textile factory.

sen.j: 主力機種
sen.e: Major aircrafts
Major aircrafts
Major aircrafts

sen.j: 九三式中間練習機ほか練習機多数。
sen.e: A large number of training aircrafts including Kyusan type Mid-size Training Aircraft were stationed at the base.
A large number of the training aircrafts including Kyusan type Mid-size Training Aircraft were stationed at the base.
A large number of the training aircrafts including Kyusan type Mid-size Training Aircraft were stationed at the base.
